page.title: 13YSGOL-Y-LLYS and PENMORFA
page.content: {Ysgol-y-Llys}is the{Welsh medium primary school for the{Prestatyn area.The school draws children from all over the area & has about 135 pupils at present.The school teaches all subjects through the{Welsh {language.}This reflects the Local Education Authority's policy of providing parents with the choice of Welsh or English medium school for their children to attend. {Ysgol Penmorfa's }name comes from its position ,at the top of the marshes. Pen = head or top, Morfa = marshes. The name {Penmorfa}is Welsh.The English name would be 'Top of the Marshes'. This year{Ysgol Penmorfa}is celebrating its 25th Anniversary.As part of the celebrations we have had two concerts,and two anniversary parties,one of each for the Juniors and for the Infants.
